long: Meaning: properly, "abrupt", i.e. "a precipice"; by implication, the "front"; used only adverbially (with prepositional prefix) "opposite".  Usage: (over) against, before, (fore-) front, from, (God-) ward, toward, with.  Source: or "מוֹל"; (Deuteronomy 1:1), or "מוֹאל"; (Nehemiah 12:38), or "מֻל"; (Numbers 22:5), from "H4135";
